description: A legal action filed by a person who has suffered physical, emotional, or financial harm due to the carelessness or wrongful act of another.

elements.name: Duty of Care
elements.description: The defendant owed the plaintiff a legal duty to act with a certain level of care.

elements.name: Breach of Duty
elements.description: The defendant failed to meet the standard of care required by their duty.

elements.name: Causation
elements.description: The defendant's breach of duty was the actual and proximate cause of the plaintiff's injuries.

elements.name: Damages
elements.description: The plaintiff suffered actual, legally compensable harm as a result of the injury.

description: A civil claim filed when one party to a legally binding agreement fails to honor its promises, causing financial harm to the other party.

elements.name: Existence of a Valid Contract
elements.description: A legally enforceable contract was formed (offer, acceptance, consideration).

elements.name: Plaintiff's Performance
elements.description: The plaintiff fulfilled their obligations under the contract.

elements.name: Defendant's Breach
elements.description: The defendant failed to perform their contractual duties.

elements.name: Resulting Damages
elements.description: The defendant's breach caused the plaintiff to suffer quantifiable financial losses.

evidenceSuggestions: Invoices, Receipts, and Proof of Payment

description: A simplified, informal, and inexpensive process for resolving civil disputes where the amount of money at stake is $5,000 or less.

elements.name: Jurisdictional Amount
elements.description: The amount in dispute must not exceed $5,000.

elements.name: Valid Civil Claim
elements.description: The underlying allegation must be a recognizable civil cause of action.

elements.name: Territorial Jurisdiction
elements.description: The defendant must be located on, or the incident must have occurred on, the Eastbank of Orleans Parish.

description: A legal process through which a landlord can reclaim possession of a rental property from a tenant.

elements.name: Landlord-Tenant Relationship
elements.description: A valid lease or rental agreement exists.

elements.name: Grounds for Eviction
elements.description: A lawful reason to evict (e.g., non-payment of rent).

elements.name: Proper Notice to Vacate
elements.description: The landlord delivered a written 'Notice to Vacate' to the tenant.

evidenceSuggestions: Copy of the Notice to Vacate
Photographs or Videos of property damage

description: The taking or misappropriation of anything of value that belongs to another person, without consent or by fraudulent means, with the intent to permanently deprive the owner of their property.

elements.name: A Misappropriation or Taking
elements.description: The offender exercised wrongful control over the property.

elements.name: A Thing of Value
elements.description: The object of the theft must have some value.

elements.name: Belonging to Another
elements.description: The property was owned by someone other than the offender.

elements.name: Without Consent or by Fraudulent Means
elements.description: The taking was done without permission or through deceit.

elements.name: Intent to Permanently Deprive
elements.description: The offender meant to keep the item from the owner for good.

evidenceSuggestions: Circumstantial Evidence (e.g., possession of stolen goods)

description: The threat or attempt to cause physical harm. Aggravated assault involves the use of a dangerous weapon.

elements.name: Attempted Battery OR Intentional Apprehension
elements.description: The offender either attempted to cause harm or intentionally placed the victim in reasonable fear of harm.

elements.name: With a Dangerous Weapon (for Aggravated Assault)
elements.description: The assault was committed using a dangerous weapon.

evidenceSuggestions: Photographs or Videos of the incident

description: A lawsuit against a state or local government official who, while acting in their official capacity, violated a citizen's rights as secured by the U.S. Constitution or federal law.

elements.name: Acting Under Color of State Law
elements.description: The defendant was a government employee performing their job-related duties.

elements.name: Deprivation of Federal Rights
elements.description: The defendant's actions violated a right guaranteed by the U.S. Constitution or a federal statute.

evidenceSuggestions: Police Reports and Internal Affairs Files
Body Camera or Dashboard Camera Footage
